types.VNode: fields: type string|Function, props object, children array, key string|number|null, _dom DOMElement|null
types.Fiber: fields: type string|Function|null, key string|number|null, props object, stateNode DOMElement|object|null, child Fiber|null, sibling Fiber|null, parent Fiber|null, alternate Fiber|null, effectTag number, nextEffect Fiber|null, memoizedState HookInstance|any|null, updateQueue UpdateQueue|null, tag number, pendingProps object, memoizedProps object
types.HookInstance: fields: memoizedState any, queue Queue|null, next HookInstance|null, cleanup function|null
types.Context: fields: value any, Provider FunctionComponent, Consumer FunctionComponent
types.SyntheticEvent: fields: nativeEvent Event, type string, target DOMElement, currentTarget DOMElement
types.EventRegistry: fields: Map<string, Array<{fiber: Fiber, handler: Function}>>

methods.createElement(type, props, ...children): Creates virtual node with normalized children handling falsey values
methods.render(vnode, container) returns void: Mounts virtual DOM tree with namespace handling
methods.setDOMProperty(domElement, propName, pro: Sets a property on a DOM element, handling special cases
methods.removeDOMProperty(domElement, propName,: Removes property with special handling for event listeners
methods.createFiber(vnode, parent, alternate) re: Creates a new Fiber node for a given VNode
methods.createStateHook(initialState) returns Ho: Creates a new Hook instance for a state hook
methods.createEffectHook(effectFunction, deps) r: Creates a new Hook instance for an effect hook
methods.reconcileChildren(currentFiber, newChild: Core diffing algorithm for fiber children
methods.commitWork(fiber) returns void: Applies effectTag changes to the DOM
methods.updateDOMProperties(domElement, prevProp: Diffs and applies prop changes with event listener cleanup
methods.performUnitOfWork(fiber) returns Fiber|n: Processes a single fiber and returns the next fiber to work on
methods.workLoop(deadline) returns void: Main loop that processes units of work during idle time
methods.commitRoot() returns void: Commits the entire finished work-in-progress tree to the DOM
methods.scheduleIdleCallback(callback) returns v: Schedules callback for browser idle periods with fallback
methods.commitDeletion(fiber) returns void: Handles deletion of a fiber and its subtree
methods.beginHookDispatcher(fiber) returns void: Sets up the hook dispatcher for a new function component render
methods.endHookDispatcher() returns void: Cleans up the dispatcher after component render
methods.advanceToNextHook() returns void: Advances to the next hook in the linked list
methods.getHookInstance(hookType, initialValue): Gets the hook instance for the current hook call, creating if needed
methods.validateKey(key, fiber) returns void: Warns about duplicate keys in development mode
methods.useDeferredValue(value) returns any: Returns a deferred version of the value
methods.createPortal(children, container) return: Creates a portal for rendering outside hierarchy

constants.FIBER_TYPES: Enum for HOST, FUNCTION, CLASS, TEXT fiber tags
constants.HOOK_TYPES: Enum: STATE, EFFECT, REDUCER, CONTEXT, REF, MEMO, CALLBACK
constants.NULL_COMPONENT: Special symbol for null/undefined component types

terms.Virtual DOM: In-memory JavaScript representation of the real DOM tree
terms.Reconciliation: Process of comparing two Virtual DOM trees and calculating the minimal DOM updates
terms.Imperative: Programming paradigm describing explicit steps to change state
terms.Declarative: Programming paradigm describing the desired end state
terms.Fiber: A unit of work in the React renderer, representing a node in the component tree with additional scheduling links
terms.Hooks: Functions that let you 'hook into' state and lifecycle features from function components
terms.Effect: A side effect (data fetch, subscription, manual DOM mutation) that needs to run after render
terms.Render Phase: Pure computation phase where VNodes are created and compared
terms.Commit Phase: Atomic DOM mutation phase where all changes are applied
terms.Work-in-progress tree: The Fiber tree currently being constructed during the render phase
terms.Alternate: Pointer from a Fiber in the work-in-progress tree to its counterpart in the current (committed) tree
terms.Unit of Work: A single Fiber node to be processed
terms.Stale Closure: Function closure capturing outdated values from previous render
terms.Dependency Array: Array of values that an effect depends on; changes trigger re-execution
terms.Error Boundary: Component that catches JavaScript errors in its child tree
terms.Key Reconciliation: Efficient list reordering using stable identifiers
terms.Prop Diffing: Comparing old and new props to determine minimal DOM updates
terms.JSDOM: Headless implementation of the DOM and web standards in Node.js
terms.Snapshot Testing: Testing technique that captures the output of a function/data structure and compares it to a stored reference
terms.Context: Mechanism for sharing values across component tree without prop drilling
terms.Portal: Component that renders children into a different DOM subtree
terms.Hydration: Process of attaching to existing server-rendered DOM
terms.Memoization: Optimization technique of caching results based on inputs
terms.Concurrent Rendering: Ability to work on multiple UI versions with prioritization
terms.Reducer: Pure function that calculates next state from current state and action
terms.Ref: Mutable object for accessing DOM nodes or component instances
terms.Suspense: Mechanism for handling asynchronous operations during render
terms.Memorization: Optimization technique of caching results based on inputs
